statuses.name: CASTING
statuses.rules: Creatures gain the CASTING state whenever they have a CAST card present on the turn tracker. While CASTING, a creature cannot willingly move or take any actions until the CAST card has resolved. If any event or effect would move their turn card ahead of their CAST card, their turn card instead moves to just below their CAST card. If a CASTING creature is DOWNED, remove their CAST card from the turn tracker. Creatures cannot normally have more than 1 CAST card on the turn tracker at a given time.

statuses.name: DOWNED
statuses.rules:
When a Hero or one of their allies has their HP reduced to 0, they become DOWNED. A DOWNED creature cannot take turns, spend battle dice, use actions, counters, boosts, or willingly move. DOWNED creatures can be subjected to forced movement, but only by enemies or as a part of resolving an offensive action against them. DOWNED is a state only experienced by Heroes and their allies‚Äî enemies are dead (or ‚Äúdefeated‚Äù, if your game uses generally lower narrative stakes for battle) when their HP reaches 0.
DOWNED creatures immediately remove all statuses and other non-status states other than DOWNED from themselves. They cannot benefit from heal effects. The only effects that can affect them are raise effects, which return them to an amount of HP equal to the raise effect (e.g. ‚Äúraise 4‚Äù would return a DOWNED creature to 4 HP). DOWNED creatures keep their turn card on the turn tracker to track when they have to roll for wounds (p. XX).

statuses.name: FLYING
statuses.rules: FLYING creatures are creatures that are considered to be (or be capable of) constantly flying/hovering in place during battle. Unless otherwise stated, all of their movement is considered flying. They are not affected by ground-based terrain like most difficult terrain or most damaging terrain. Certain spells & abilities also may have more or less of an effect on FLYING creatures.
